results.title: Between the tides
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Reveals some of the animal and plant life not always visible to the naked eye, and shows the fascinating creatures which can be found in rock pools and shallow waters among the breeding grounds of Britain’s sea-birds. The film brings to light a wealth of pictorial information in the best traditions of the nature documentary film and was awarded prizes at a number of international film festivals between 1958 and 1960.

results.title: Between glass and concrete
results.brief_description: This film gives an impression of a number of new theatres and concert halls, and the new ideas on architecture and theatrical production which they embody. Indicates the popularity of theatre-going in Germany and the international scope of the programmes. No other credits available.

results.title: Better typing at your fingertips
results.brief_description: Typewriting champion, Norman Saksvig, and two of his girl students demonstrate common typing mistakes, including bad habits sometimes acquired at school. First, the faulty technique is shown, then in each case correct methods. Close-ups and slow motion studies accent the instruction. No other credits available.

results.title: A Better train of thought
results.creator_credit: Attila Dargay, Stephen Bosustow and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description: An animated allegorical comment on progress and power. Indignant when another train passes them, passengers on an old train try a variety of ways to speed it up - to no avail. They reject a revolutionary design proposed by one passenger, who leaves to return as the designer of an obviously superior vehicle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Attila Dargay, Stephen Bosustow and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio

results.title: Better seeds for better grasslands
results.brief_description: This film shows how researchers and seed-growers combine their efforts to raise output from grasslands. In the laboratories, strains of alfalfa, clover and other fodder crops are bred which are more resistant to disease, and more nutritious. Rigorous dampness tests, etc., eliminate all but the hardiest plants, which are then multiplied on specialist seed-farms, carefully inspected to ensure purity of the resulting seed. Reveals many other aspects of scientific farming. No other credits available.

results.title: A Better man
results.brief_description: This film shows how, in Malaya, a modern prison is not a place of punishment, but a place of reconstruction. Reveals through the eyes of a newly convicted man under sentence of ten years imprisonment, exactly what lies before him and how the prison system of progress and privileges works. At the outset, it is explained to the prisoner what opportunities may be his, so that when he leaves prison he may be a more skilful, better educated man and a valuable citizen of Malaya. No other credits available.

results.title: Better dairying
results.brief_description: Produced for Cyclone fencing, this film looks at the value of tubular steel and wire mesh in farm buildings, fencing and gates on dairy farms, especially the savings in labour and maintenance costs. The uses of steel fencing and prefabricated steel sheds are described, followed by a complete milking unit in operation. The film closes with an analysis of capital costs, savings and earnings from increased yields.

results.title: A Better breed
results.brief_description: An account of the mechanism by which inherited characteristics are handed on from generation to generation, and an introduction to Mendel’s Laws of heredity. Gives examples of the inheritance of one or more characteristics; complete and incomplete dominance; and the recombinations of characteristics resulting in new types; refers to the practical aspects of this in connection with animal husbandry. No other credits available.
